text: Zipping fast down U.S. Route 70--West. We see the mileage both sides of the median indicating where they're coming where they're now going: from Baltimore, towards Frederic Maryland. (NOTE: this is shot on 16 or 35mm film, which w medium of "reality" for the rest of the movie.) The music that's blaring isn't underscoring--it's coming inside the Van. As is a WOMAN'S VOICE (ANNA) shouting ove
You want to turn that shit down just a hair??
TIGHT ON the Driver of the Van, a grunged-out 25 year old shoulder-length hair, a well-worn black "Blair Witch Proj shirt and cap: COTTER KALLER. He yells towards the backse
Shit? This is from "Josh's Blair Witch Mix," man!
Down or off--you're giving me a migraine.
(mutters) Christ.
He turns the volume down.
(petulant) Just trying to set the mood for the mission--get the "feeling."
Only thing I'm feeling is homicidal.
Cotter grumbles. Then a wicked grin hits his lips. Turns unseen Man sitting next to him in the passenger seat:
Hold this.
What?
The wheel.
He clamps Nick's hand on the steering wheel, picks up the Camcorder beside him, turns around, and starts shooting i back seat.
On a not-very-happy-at-the-moment-looking Blonde Woman.
age 20. She rolls her eyes as Cotter begins narrating:
The bitched-out babe in back here is one Anna Tassio--we met one dark and stormy night in a Blair Witch chat room, we all did--
--Christ almighty--
--but she was nicer then--sweeter-- she hadn't vomited twice already like today--
--it's called "morning sickness," asshole--
(editorial aside) --a six week bun in the oven--
(wearily) --Cotter, just turn the camera off?
Cotter responds by panning the Camcorder towards the pass seat. We see on video:
a lanky 21 year old wearing wire-rims.
This is her equally on-the-rag boy- friend, Nick Leavitt--
--turn the camera off--
--they're from UMass, doing some kind of fucking term paper--
--Graduate Thesis--
--about the Witch--
--she doesn't exist--
--you got that right--
THE CAMERA pans again into the back seat, showing HEATHER 19, with a huge mane of fire-engine red hair.
--and if she ever did--
--which she may have--
--bullshit--
--she wasn't a witch--we embrace nature, not evil--
--thank you, Heather Arendt--and arend't we glad you're here--a real witch--
--fuckin' A right--
--Cotter--
--a Wiccan--
--turn the goddamn camera off!
The Camcorder swings back to Nick.
We're not making Blair Witch II here.
I am.
One big blur of a pan--Cotter's turned the camcorder on h issues his manifesto:
And let it be known--before we even get to Burkittsville--it's gonna be an eighteen thousand times better movie--for half the cost--
--which'd be about ten bucks--
--and unlike the first one, every second of it's gonna be true! "Blair Witch: The Real Story!"
Cotter?
I'm not finished.
We're all going to be if you don't hit the brakes.
The Camcorder WHIP=PANS towards the windshield: The Van is about to plow into the rear of a
Jee-zuz!
Visual pandemonium as the Camcorder goes flying from his down next to the

We see both of COTTER'S FEET smash down on the pedal. Hea screeching of the passengers--screeching of the brake sho screaming of the tires as the Van swerves into the next l then an angry symphony of CAR HORNS.
You're a complete fucking idiot, aren't you?
Hey, Mr. Graduate Fucking Thesis here was s'posed to be driving!
You drive, I'll handle the video, okay?
Fine.
We see the view from the Camcorder as it's scooped up fro floor and brought back up to eye-level again.
As he waves two fingers at the lens.
Bye-bye--
--and the Video zaps to black.
Where Nick can be seen tossing the camcorder into the bac Anna catches it, puts it in a back pack and zips it.
What're you doing?
This isn't about us.
Right. And the check's in the mail.
Doing a relaxed 35 down the narrow ribbon of Route 17. Ru country. The weather's turned grey--making all the 19th C vintage houses and barns they pass look dismal, if not a foreboding.
Cheery little place.
It's like traveling back in time.
The good old days: toasting marsh- mallows over a burning witch.
They never burned witches in this country, they hanged them.
Whatever--all I know is the persecution's going to start all over again, they keep pumping out inflammatory bullshit like this fucking movie--
--hey: check that out!
Ahead of them, at a crossroads, is a sign: Welcome to Burkittsville
'Thought those all got stolen.
Guess they thought it was safe to put some up again.
Think again.
He starts to slow the Van alongside the sign.
Somebody wanna hand me that claw hammer in back--
--Nick pushes Cotter's leg back down on the accelerator. jerks past the sign and down the road.
Get busted on your own time. We've got a schedule to keep.
Cotter just glares at him.
Was it every day or just semi- weekly you got your ass kicked as a kid?
(ignoring him) Now you can bring the vehicle to a stop: there on the left.
The four of them stand there by the sign to the graveyard searching the gray horizon.
Why are we here?
She e-mailed me yesterday this is where we should meet her.
Who?
Whatzername--the "psychic" Anna hired.
Domini. Domini Von Teer.
What's she look like?
No idea, just talked to her on the 'Net--she's very good.
So says her website.
She is--she's helped solve a bunch of murders: Arizona, New Mexico--
--how old?
I dunno, probably right up there, based on her resume.
Then there she blows.
Cotter points to
near the far edge of the cemetery. Standing there is an o and particularly Unattractive Woman, staring at them.
Terrific--and I was afraid I wasn't going to get laid on this trip.
The four of them start tromping towards her.
Jesus.
What?
That's not whatzername--it's Mary Brown.
From-the-movie-Mary-Brown, Trailer Park Bible Psycho?
Oh, for chrissake, she was an actor.
No, the kids were actors, the townspeople were real. Her, the Sheriff, the Convenience Store guy--
--whatever; that's her.
To the interview with Mary Brown from "Blair Witch Projec years have apparently not been kind: she looks a good two younger.
They're less than 20 feet now from MARY BROWN. She speaks without expression:
What do you want?
Just came over to say hello.
It's five bucks for signin' something; ten for signin' a Bible; twenty, you want to take a picture with me. Any kind've conversation, that's subject to negotiation.
(sotto) I don't believe this.
(sotto) I do.
Thanks just the same. I think we're fine.
Heather's not.
Heather double-takes.
Me?
Heather. I saw her. Elly Kedward's hands were on her throat, and she was sucking out the girl's insides with her mouth.
(to Heather) Heather from the movie.
Mary Brown shakes her head.
Heather.
Been a pleasure meeting you; we need to go now.
He hustles the other three back towards the cemetery.
I take it back--she wasn't an actor. She's a nutjob.
That's what Josh and Mike said.
Shut-up.
The cemetery. Everyone spread out looking for:
Domino? Domini Von Teer...??
Beat. And then, out of nowhere, seemingly just plunging r of the earth
extends into the air not far from them. Paper-pale and st almost skeletal.
Present.
They walk over. See, lying atop a cracked granite marker, Young Woman who can't be more than 18. Heroin-chic skinny black, including her make-up--uber Goth: DOMINI VON TEER.
Domini?
Yes.
What're you doing there?
Trying to find the energy.
Inside the grave?
To stand up--I'm exhausted. Been on the road since yesterday.
You want a hand?
I want amphetamines.
Cotter helps her up.
Beer and weed is what I've got.
Both. Now.
Anna and Heather look at the faded marker Domini's been l It says:
Sweet place to take a nap.
Strange girl.
You think so?
As they walk away, Heather sees Mary Brown across the cem staring at her.
Snaking its way down the road that wends through the Blac Hills.
Domini and her second beer have commandeered the shotgun relegated to a tight squeeze in the back seat. Dead silen slightly unnerving. Finally:
So, I hear you're from New Mexico!
Sometimes.
Her father's Sheriff of Taos County.
Sometimes. Where are we going?
Ruins of the Rustin Parr house.
Guy who killed all the kids in the '40s.
("Outer Limits" tremolo) "The Voiiiiices made him do it."
The Witch's voice.
She wasn't a witch.
Whatever.
I hear voices all the time.
That pretty much kills the rest of the conversation.
Parked at the edge of the woods. Back-packs being hauled rear, camping gear, video equipment.
What is all this shit?
We're doing dusk-till-dawn taping of all the places where there've been alleged Blair Witch "sightings" --the Parr House, Coffin Rock, Tappy Creek.
Why?
See what turns up--which I guarantee will be nothing. Some of the rest of the party are more hopeful--
--or incredibly fucking naive.
Hey, folklore--
--myth--
--doesn't just pop out of thin air. It spins off of real events. At some point there was a Blair Witch--
--or one huge attack of group hysteria.
(snide) Either way, maybe there's a book in it, and they both make a ton of money.
(snapping) It's a serious sociological study.
The four of you really have too much spare fucking time on your hands, don't you?
And what's your excuse for being here?
She got paid.
(shrugs) I thought the movie was bitchin'.
Mammoth backpacks strapped on, the five begin walks into forest.
Wait a sec!
He spins and runs back towards the Van.
What?
Through the trees, they see Cotter place a pint of bottle the roof of the Van. Starts video-ing it as he walks away
He really is a fucking idiot.
Slogging up a 45-degree angled hill. This is not exactly Hillary and Co.--the five of them already look exhausted.
Didn't we already do this hill?
Nick is staring at three different maps at once as he wal
No.
You sure?
Yes.
Terrific: an hour, we're already lost--
--and then a look of trepidation crosses Cotter's face--
Footage from "Blair Witch Project"--panic, as Heather, Jo Mike realize they've spent all day walking in a circle.
Cotter?
Nick's glaring at him.
What?
Look over there.
Cotter looks up: less than 500 yards ahead can be seen th an Old House.
Okay, but--
--now there.
--Nick is pointing behind him. Cotter looks. From the ato he can see down to the road--and his Van with the water b the roof.
Oh. Cool.

All the backpacks and miscellaneous tonnage is already du the ground. The five of them stretch their legs, massage shoulders and lower backs, while sightseeing the remnants old house and its environs. Cotter, not surprisingly, is taping everything.
a huge bite taken out of one of the walls of the foundati brick and soil strewn everywhere around it.
Where they found the backpacks and all the film a year later.
Buried deep under 200 years worth of soil, ash, and compost layers.
Yeah, that was a cluster-fuck for the mind.
If it happened at all.
Suddenly, the camcorder image starts shaking wildly.
Cotter seen running full-tilt towards Heather, who's faci the interior foundation walls. He's jiggling the camera l got St. Vitus dance.
We hear Cotter doing a passable Heather Donahue impressio screeching as the shaking video image PUSHES IN right tow Heather Arendt's face.
Mike! Miiiiiiike! Noooooo!
Heather turns, scowling, and puts her hand over the lens.
Heather pushing the camcorder out of her face.
You're not only an idiot, you're a goddamn child.
Why does everyone here but me have have a gigantic stick up their ass?
Hey! Check this out!
On one of the foundation's interior walls: a gobbledygook handprints and strange, angular glyphs.
Look at those marks--just like in the movie.
Ancient runes--
--what the fuck's a "rune"?--
Nick erasing half the marks with one sweep of his palm.
--chalked just hours ago by ancient adolescents. It's called vandalism.
What is this?
All turn. She's pointing to the large, leafy tree with br stretching everywhere above them.
Oak?
No. What's it doing here in the middle of the foundation?
Growing. This place burnt down 50 years ago. Trees happen.
Nick flips through a voluminous loose-leaf notebook--poin page to Anna.
Look it's right here--from the Blair Witch "Dossier"--the sketch the anthropology students made of their dig when they found the backpack.
The sketch shows a spindly growth in the middle of the fo no more than six feet high.
That's a sapling--this mother's got to be three hundred years old, minimum.
It's a sketch, Anna--it's not to- scale cartography; the tree was not the kids' focus--
--do you agree it's that old, Nick?
Okay, fine, whatever, yes--it's an old tree.
Why don't you just cut it down and count the goddamn rings--who cares?
Because it means the tree is older than the house.
Yeah, so?
So whoever built this--
--Nick rustles through the loose-leaf--
--brother of Rustin Parr's maternal grandfather, somewhere after 1858--
--whoever--they built an entire house around a tree. Sticking up right through the living room. Somebody like to explain that to me?
The rest of the family was crazy as Rusty Parr.
Oh, c'mon--even you have to admit this is weird.
No--this is weird.
He reaches down and picks one of the now infamous wooden men" off the ground.

Sudden, stunned silence as the camera examines it fore an And then Nick's hands are seen removing the material that the Stick Man's "arms" to his "torso." Torso and legs fal ground, leaving Nick holding a piece of--
--sacred and occult Scotch Tape.
Rusty Parr had the right idea on child care.

By flashlight, Cotter's fiddling with five vid-cams on tr have already been set up. Domini lies within the foundation walls staring up at the Finishes the last of Cotter's beer and discards the empty Not far from there, Heather's already got her simple one- tent erected. Adjacent, Nick and Anna are wrestling with the nightmare to put up some Barnum & Bailey-size number.
Your parents didn't have a bigger one?
It was free--I recall that was the chief selling point for you.
No offense, sweetheart: fuck you.
You know, Nick, you've been something of a total asshole the past few days.
Pardon me, I've had a few things on my mind--like putting this safari together.
Like how weirded-out you are with this pregnancy thing.
Let's just leave it at: it was one hell of a surprise.
You don't want it though.
Your body, your call.
Why is there no "our" here?
Could we take this up later--like indoors, without half the world listening?
You feel no need to get married or anything.
Anna--
--fine, later, fine.
Sonovabitch!!
All eyes turn: Cotter's standing 20 feet away with rotted tentpoles and a piece of grommeted canvas that's literall disintegrating in his hands.
Nice tent.
Hadn't even opened the thing since Cub scouts.
Never would've guessed.
So where the hell am I going to sleep?
If you're looking at me, look elsewhere.
I've got the Panasonic Portable DVD player.
Beat. She stares at him.
What movies?
Ask me what I don't have.

Heather and Cotter jammed in there like Spam, sharing a j watching "Curse of the Blair Witch" on DVD: The Interview Sequence with folklorist CHARLES MOOREHOUSE explaining the "origins" of the Blair Witch story--Elly K banishment, etc.
What I never could figure about the movie?
What?
Three people: two guys, a girl-- sleeping in the same motel room, the same tent night after night.
Yeah?
No fucking.
No.
Made no sense. Scared out of their minds, and the greatest stress reliever in creation right at their fingertips. Nada.
No sense at all. (beat) I'm a little stressed.
Try a long walk.

It ain't the Ritz, but they did come prepared: air mattre Coleman lanterns, a kerosene heater--and heaps of books a brimming file folders. They're sitting up in their respective mummy-style sleepi studying documents, making notes-- --when this high-pitched MOANING can be heard outside the Nick and Anna looks at each other. Nick grabs one of the and dashes for the tent door.
He shines the light slowly out into the foundation ruins- --and there's Domini, still lying on her back, staring up
Oooh. Oooh.
Ah, Domini?
What?
You planning on sleeping out there?
Not planning on sleeping at all.
She points up into the big oak in the middle of the found
Oooh. Oooh.
The call comes back to her from the tree: "oooh-oooh." Nick sees perched high up on one of the branches: A GREAT OWL. It's staring down at them.
I figure I lie here long enough, maybe he'll swoop down and carry me off in his talons.
Nick rolls his eyes and goes back into his tent.
are also watching this from their tent.
We should be so lucky.
Butt-ugly owl.
They duck back into the tent. The Owl keeps watching. FADE TO BLACK. Several beats. And then in the darkness, a rustling sound A whisper that sounds like:
...see if it's alive--
CLICK! Then Anna's hand seen--she's just turned on one of lanterns. Sits up in her sleeping bag. Listens. The sound stopped. Beat. She gets out of her bag, grabs the lantern, and goe tent flap--
--and just as she steps outside-- --something strikes her hand--
--shit--
--the lantern goes flying into the dirt-- --and suddenly out of the darkness come flying--
wielding small sharpened sticks--or are they tent pegs?-- --and they stab into Anna's belly again and again, accomp shrieks of delight. Anna screams--
Who's James?
and finds she's inside the tent, wrapped tight in her sle Staring at Nick, who's propped up on his air mattress wit and a lantern, staring quizzically back at her.
(disoriented) What?
You said the name "James."
I don't know.
She pulls her sleeping bag down, looks at her belly--unma unharmed, bloodless.
Baby names?
I don't know. Nightmare.
You want me to scooch over next to you?
Yes.
Domini is still supine, staring upwards.
This place is like a regular K-mart of bad vibes, ain't it, pal?
The Owl doesn't respond.
(distant) Please, someone, help me--
a static shot of dark, dark woods. The Voice continues to from somewhere deep in there:
--somebody, please!
It's coming from the DVD of "Blair Witch Project."
Josh?!?
Cotter and Heather Arendt are fast asleep. Must have drif during the umpteenth viewing.
(much louder) Heather???
Heather Arendt is up like a shot.
Heather?? Josh???
Mild snort of amusement when she sees the movie's still p the DVD. She buttons it off. Starts to lay back down--
(loud) Heather????
--bolts right back up on the verge of a coronary. The Man's Voice screams:
They're pulling my teeth out!!
Heather literally punches Cotter awake.
Wha' the--
She clamps her hand over his mouth. Beat. They listen-- --suddenly, SCURRYING FOOTSTEPS heard; giggling--
(through her hand) --o-fug-me--
Heaaaaather???
Cotter wrenches himself away, grabs his little 8mm camcor
(scared) What're you, crazy??
(exhilarated) What're you, nuts?
He lunges out of the tent, camera already whirring--
--and right into a blinding, light-up-the-night battery o lamps.
Jesus!
Halo-ed in the glare of those lights stand
in various states of grunge. They all but scream of STONE them's got a huge running Beta-Cam on shoulder, another's a DAT recorder and shotgun mic. We see Cotter from the POV of these guys camera:
Cotter shooting back at them with his puny-by-comparison his thermal long-johns halfway down his legs.
Check this out: Burkittsville's Funniest Home Videos.
Cotter's still shaking.
Jesus-Jesus-Jesus--
A furious Heather can be seen scrambling out of the tent. right in the lens:
What the fuck?!?
The Stoner Cameraman snaps the Beta away from her.
Hey, that's 50K worth of hi-tech, chickee.
You gave me a fucking heart attack!
Oh, and you boogied all the way up here to get a good night's sleep.
We just made your every dream come true, darlin'.
Get out of here!
What're you doing with all this shit?
Shootin' "Blair Witch II," man-- what's your excuse?
Shooting "Blair Witch II."
Oh, dude, I don't think so--that is just not happening.
This is our gig.
We got jurisdiction, man--we got fuckin' permits to be here.
Oh, yeah? Let's see 'em.
They're, uh, like, in the car.
Bullshit.
Let's put it this way: one of us is going, and it's you.
What's the hassle here?
Nick and Anna appear from their tent.
You and the Brady Bunch, Mr. Scorsese.
You're interfering with the commerce of independent film!
Cotter asides to Nick.
They're making "Blair Witch II," too.
No problem, just give us 'til dawn and we're gone.
What?
Look, guys, we're cold, we're tired we're shook--we just want to get out of here as soon as there's light. We saw something up at Coffin Rock today--
(catching on) --or someone--
--scared the living shit out of us.
What?
I don't know, I don't know--
--yeah, a hand or something--
--coming out of the water--
Now even Domini joins the prevarication party, popping up inside the foundation:
--stop it! Stop talking about it! I'm gonna freak!
(tearing up) I just wanna go home.
(impressed) Whoa.
You didn't get it on tape, didja?
Tried, but--
Stoner #2 starts barking orders to his crew:
Strip it down and ship it out! Coffin Rock!
They're packed up and ready to move in a flash. Stoner #4 they trot off:
Any other voices or noises you hear tonight--it ain't us.
The Stoners make Josh Leonard-like cries as they disappea into the darkness;
Heather??? Mike???? Somebody??? Please????
They were never seen again. Their footage was found a year later-- underexposed and useless.
Tired laughter.
How're the cameras doing?
Due for a re-load and battery check. I'll get on it.
'Give you a hand. I think my sleep for the night just ended.
Join the club.
Well, everybody grab a coat, and pull up a rock for a night of witch-watch.
The four campers proceed to their respective tasks. Domini stays perched on the foundation, watching where th disappeared. To herself:
Something....really twisted...is going to happen.
She looks up. The Owl's gone. FADE TO BLACK. Birds heard in the darkness. And snoring.
Cuddled together, fast asleep.
Domini conked out on the grass, curled in a fetal positio
Ditto Heather, sprawled half-in/half-out of her sleeping Only Cotter is awake--well, making an attempt at it, anyw Squints at his digital watch: 5:45am.
Jesus...wha' happened...
He groggily gets to his knees and dog-walks out of the te Several beats. And then we hear outside the tent:
Oh, fuck me! Oh, Jesus!
The cries wake Heather--
--as well as Nick and Anna--
--even Domini, who pops her head up and starts to ask:
What happ--
--and then she sees; they all see--
--they're all gone!--
--five tripods, all minus the Video cameras they used to
--and none of 'em were mine! I-am-so-fucked, I-am-so-fucked-- where the hell was everybody???
Asleep--
--what happened to the goddamn "Witch-watch??"
--I dunno, I just woke up--
--last thing I remember were those four clowns shooting the movie--
--yeah, the goddamn stoners! Who you think stole the stuff!?
Yeah. Got to Coffin Rock, found zip, and came back, ripped off the cameras.
Domini looks at one of the mangled tripods.
Ripped? They look like they were bit off.
Smells Like Teenage Spirit.
This is funny?? This is tens of thousands of fucking dollars! (shouts into the woods) You pricks! I'll see you in fucking court!!
Not the only things missing, Nick.
Nick turns. Anna's at the tent door holding a pile of emp folders and two looseleaf notebooks that have somehow bee clean in half. Now Nick's incensed:
That's almost a year's worth of work! (into the woods) Scumbags! Oh, Jesus, Jesus....
At least you still have the tapes.
One set. Everything from midnight on--
--no, I think they're all in there.

She's pointing to the collapsed section of the basement f where the original "Blair Witch Project" Tapes were found The other four stop and stare at her. And then Cotter goes diving in the hole. Beat.
Sonovabitch!
And emerges with two grimy handfuls of VHS, Beta, and 8mm tapes.
Those ours?
Cotter brushes dirt from them; holds them up for inspecti
My handwriting on the face labels.
And then his excitement switches to confusion. Turns to D
How'd you know they were--
(shrugs) --hunch. Just sort've saw 'em there.
My ass--you saw those four fucking baboons put 'em there!
No.
Cotter, I think she's right. Why would those guys go to all the trouble of stealing the camera and all this other stuff and leave the tapes?
Spite.
They were making a movie--if they were going to steal anything it'd be just the tapes, to see if we had anything they didn't.
I don't think it was them.
Oh, who did then? Blair Witch? Snatching equipment to make her own sequel?
I don't know yet.
Well, please keep me fucking informed!
Those four guys--it's the only thing that makes sense.
She looks over at Domini, who says nothing--just stares i woods.
This is a goddamn disaster. Let's just pack it up and go.
I want to see the tapes.
And what do you possibly think you're going to fucking see there?
No idea. But if that's all we've got left--
--nothing left to play 'em on, honey.
Oh, sorry, right.
You can be goddamn sure, though, I'm going to be looking at every second of 'em when I get back to Baltimore--I get proof who stole my shit and I call the cops!
We're ticketed to fly back from Baltimore, anyway.
Me, too.
Hey, I got a whole editing suite in my loft--more the fucking merrier.
Pointless.
No. I don't think so.
The Van pulls up to the curb in a savagely decrepit and e desolate old industrial section of North Baltimore.
403 41st Street, kids: home.
I dunno it's safe to even get out of the car.
By day? No sweat.
What about night?
Not a great idea. Especially 'cross the street.
All four look: a thickly wooded area that looks like most
Druid Hill Park.
That's a joke?
That's its name. A pastoral glade gamboling with crackheads and homeless and averaging at least one homicide a week.
Let's get inside.
First enormous brick warehouse on your right.
Four of the five of them ride nervously in a huge, ancien that ascends in a series of jerks. Cotter's oblivious.
Used to be a meat-packing plant. Slaughter on the ground floor-- carcasses schlepped up on this thing for dissection and grinding and--
--Cotter: shut up.
What?
Cotter opens the elevator grates, revealing a metal door single lock. He fits a key into it
Just one lock in this neighbor- hood?
All I need--
--throws the door wide-- --the LOUD BARKING of what sounds like a pack of pit-bull them.
Get inside quick, they'll stop.
Too busy eating us?
Just go.
He shuts the door; the BARKING stops. Everyone's eyes zap 360 degrees around them: no dogs. Cotter taps a small speaker above the door;
Baltimore's cheapest burglar alarm.
He re-opens the door a crack--the BARKING starts anew. Cl Nothing.
Had the door jimmied a few times. Nobody's yet made it inside.
He ushers them into a huge

easily 30 feet high. Exposed brick walls--massive iron ro And crammed to bursting with bizarre esoterica everywhere --carousel horses, huge airplane propellers, a bowsp'rit old clipper ship, lawn jockeys, a set of bunkbeds made en wagon wheel parts, bowling balls, cannonballs, pinball ma
Mi casa y su casa!
Su casa y shit-o hole-o.
Hey, hon'--this is what pays the rent and tuition.
Running a junk yard.
A Cyber Entrepreneurialship.
English.
I spend a lot of time on e-Bay. Buying, selling--sometimes buying then re-selling at substantial mark-up, sometimes just selling crap I find in the street.
Looks like business is booming.
There's some stuff that's hard to part with. Editing's stuff's up there--
--he points to a loft overhanging the big room--a thin wo railing separating the work space from a sheer 20 foot dr
--stairs are back through the kitchen--and a ton of bedrooms, you wanna dump your stuff or catch a nap--

Cotter's running tape through his new video iMac. The res are gathered around the screen in various degrees of disc They look like they've been there for some time. A lot of Nick's rubbing his temples like somebody's pounding a mar inside his head. ON SCREEN: they're all watching minute after minute of no Darkness. The outlines of the Parr Foundation. Trees in t ground. Silence. Several beats as they continue to watch this stasis. Then
I think we get the gist.
We've looked at half of one tape.
There's four other angles, man, we haven't even--
--great: we can watch Domini sleep for hours--or, shit, maybe if we stay at it for a couple of days, maybe a deer'll dash by!
For once could you just sit down, shut up, and give something a chance?
We're leaving--case dismissed for lack of evidence. Maybe on the ride home we can figure how the fuck we're going to graduate with no thesis.
I'm not going anywhere, 'til--
--bullshit!
Hey, chill, man--
--there's something here, Nick--
--fuck you--all off you--
--he grabs Anna by the wrist and yanks her up--
--now c'mon!
Get your goddamn--
--and suddenly Anna stops. Doubles over, clutching her ab
What--
--oh, Jesus--
--blood can be seen soaking through her jeans.
I need to go to a hospital.
Domini, Heather and Cotter standing grimly in the Waiting Finally, they see Nick exiting a Trauma Room, looking eve
She lost it.
Nick nods.
Anna's lying on a OB/Gyn table in a johnnie, clearly seda with a face and eyes still soaked with tears. An E.R. INT (Female) is cleaning her up.
Why?
Any number of reasons--pick one, it's as good as the other.
I was out hiking, camping the past two days--that's what did it--I killed it--
--doubtful, Mrs. Leavitt. The main thing to remember is, whatever the reason, it was for the best-- it meant something was wrong.
Something was wrong.
Look, this is not my field of expertise. You seem stabilized, but why take any chances? Let's keep you overnight and have the Staff obstetrician do a follow-up tomorrow.
I guess--
--and then Anna sees what the Intern is writing on her ch To see    Boyd Kurth 5/26/00
Anna's eyes go wide.
she flashes on the grave marker that Domini laid on in th Burkittsville Cemetery: same name, same date.
Anna yells:
No!
Mrs. Leavitt--
--I'm not staying here!
Let's talk to your husband--
--he's not my husband!
She's flails at the Intern, trying to get up, tearing pag chart.
Where are my clothes??
They all sit silently as Cotter drives. The now-fully clo just sits in back like a zombie.
(softly) We'll stay overnight, get a hotel--
--Cotter's--
--whatever you want, no problem--
--still go see the OB in the morning--
--no.
Anna tosses a crumpled ball of paper into Domini's lap. S it. It's the top page of Anna's chart. Domini looks at th jotting "see Boyd Kurth--" --her head snaps up. Beat.
Nick. Do what she says.
Nick tucks her into an elderly four-poster bed. Colonial Another one of Cotter's "finds."
What can I get you?
Sleep.
She closes her eyes.
Domini, Heather and Cotter gathered around his iMac, drin
Something happened to Anna in Burkittsville, in the woods, I don't know.
What? That made her lose the baby?
Something. Someone.
Who? What?
Domini just shakes her head.
Women miscarry all the--
--no.
This is a little nuts.
Turn the tapes back on.
Fine.
He goes to it. Without even looking, Domini pulls the sho her shirt down, rubs something on her upper arm. Heather a good-sized burgundy-colored mark, oblong, vaguely spide shape.
What's that?
Hmm? I dunno. Chafing from the backpack, something.
That'd be up on your shoulder, maybe your lower back.
Then I have no idea.
And now Cotter's staring at it.
Does it hurt?
Like hell. Play the goddamn tape.
The first image that pops up is Domini sprawled out on th the Parr Foundation. Deep in REM sleep, her leg jerking l dog's. Domini sees it--a snort of embarrassed laughter.

Nick bolts awake to the sound of laughter. Looks next to Anna's fast asleep. He looks relieved--then clucks to him he sees that he's fallen asleep next to her on the big ol poster with his clothes on. Starts to take off his shirt-- --and then hears the laughter again. Louder. It seems to him off. He gets out of bed, opens the door. Hisses:
Hey, knock it off, willya?
But there's nobody there. He walks down the hallway towar kitchen.
Nick appears on the stairs leading into the work-loft. Se three of them huddled over the iMac.
You wanna keep it down, she's trying to sleep.
Sorry, I didn't think we were making that much noise.
It's not a real "funny" time for us, okay?
(confused) No....it's not.
Nick just shakes his head, snorts with disgust. Goes back stairs--
--when he hears the laughter again.
Christ almighty--
--he starts to storm back up the stairs to the loft-- --when he realizes he's walking away from the sound of th laughter. He stops. It's coming from the hallway--
--further down the hallway. Louder. He walks faster towar It's coming from the open door of his and Anna's bedroom. trot. Louder. Takes the corner into--
--the laughter stops-- --as does Anna, who appeared for a moment to be twirling around in the middle of the room.
What's going on?
Anna looks down at herself and lets loose a giggle of ast
Nothing. I dunno--
--you should get back into bed.
I guess, yeah.
She does so. Nick once again tucks her in.
Was that you laughing?
What?
Just now?
No.
Just...try and go back to sleep.
I get dreams. I don't like 'em.
What'd you dream?
Little boys. Looking up my skirt as I danced. Giggling.
Here.
He pops out two Xanax from a hospital sample bubble pack. them to Anna.
This'll help.
She swallows them dry.
Good.
She closes her eyes.
There--
Domini's pointing to the iMac screen.
There, what? I didn't see anything.
Back it up, rewind, whatever you call it.
Fine.
He does so.
What'd you see?
Motion. Stop there. Play it again.
Cotter hits PLAY. They're watching tape from a camera tha placed almost to the ground, aimed upwards--
--there! In the tree.
Cotter freezes the image. The tree is so dark and so far distance of the shot, he and Heather have to put their ey up to the screen to even see it.
Whatta you got, telescopic vision?
Still don't see it--
--that blur, right by that branch.
She puts her finger right on the screen. Cotter quickly r --squints.
Okay, a blur.
Can you zoom it or something, make it real close, real big?
I'm the ebay Boy, remember? I can't exactly afford that kind of equipment.
Who do you know who can? Where do we go?
For a blur?
There is something there--don't ask, just trust me.
Can't you like just divine it?
If I could do that, I'd be at the goddamn racetrack, not here.
(sighing) I got a friend at a Lab. I could get the whole thing blown-up, enhanced--
--go!
Four in the morning?
Cotter wearily unlocks the door to his Van. He looks all around him--finally up: There's an Owl staring down at him from a tree in Druid H across the street.
Heather is bringing a cup of hot tea and 40 ounce bottle Liquor up the stairs. Sees Domini still in front of the i trying to figure out how to work the thing.
Cotter'll kill you.
He'll never know.
Two-to-one he dusts the keyboard for fingerprints the second he gets back.
She hands Domini the beer. Keeps the tea for herself.
At least go drink it somewhere spilling it won't drive him to suicide.
Okay.
Domini gets up and slumps down on the broken-backed couch work-loft.
What is it you thought you saw on that tape?
Still working on it.
Elly Kedward?
No. Elly Kedward's not the problem here, I don't think. She was just a good old-fashioned white witch--

head_text.subj: PAGE 62 IS MISSING FROM THE HARD COPY OF THIS SCRIPT

text: You're gonna owe me the rest of your life, bud.
I know, I know.
Beta Cam's still coming back tomorrow, right?
Beat. Cotter flushes for a moment.
Absolutely.
Before 5:00--
--hours before--
--Christ, they find out I let you have it for the weekend--
--no one'll ever know.
Sid pauses the tape.
This is what you wanted enhanced?
Yeah.
You mind me asking: why the fuck?
The, uh, blur there.
Looks like a rope.

Heather has apparently gained a tad enough mastery to run through the iMac. She's playing and replaying a short section of Cotter's c tape where the bunch of them were interacting with the St Crew. She keeps seeing a FLASH on the tape. Between two trees f background. But she can't seem to freeze the image inside flash. It looks vaguely like a MIDDLE-AGED MAN.
Does this look like a person stand there to you? (no response) Domini...?
She turns. Sitting on the couch where Domini was is now t clear presence of
in a topcoat. He says nothing, just stares straight ahead a horrible wound in his forehead. Heather is mindboggled--and petrified. She manages to sta the word:
Dad...?
What'd you say?
Heather's neck snaps to her right. She's sitting on that with Domini. Her eyes scan the entire loft. There's no one there but t women.
Are you alright?
....I don't know.
Beat. And then in the darkness, a pack of dogs heard BARK
He's having trouble getting the key out of the lock. The wide open. The recorded pit-bulls bark and bark and bark.
The barking bolts Heather and Domini up like a shot.
Likewise Nick. Anna doesn't seem to hear it--fast asleep. As soon as Nick makes it to the door, the barking stops.
Nick, Domini and Heather are gathered around him like kid Christmas.
So lemme see it.
Just let me get my coat off--I had eight cups of coffee, I'm wired for sound here.
Where is it?
I got the tape enhanced--and I managed to sleaze a photo blow-up. Jesus, he's gonna kill me when he finds out about the camera.
Gimme it!
Cotter throws her the 8"x10" blow-up of the frame. Heather looks at it, her face falls.
Still looks like a blur, only bigger.
Domini grabs it. Stares at it, puzzled.
My friend Sid said it looked like a rope.
And now Domini's eyes go wide.
Jesus.
What?
That's the reason.
What?
Why she kills children.
The witch?
It's not about witches, goddamnit!
Someone want to tell me what's going on--
--and we brought it back with us!
What?
It touched me, don't you see it now?
She yanks down the shoulder of her shirt: the burgundy-co on her arm has grown larger and more distinct. It seems t finger-like tendrils spreading out from it.
Its fingers! Here. And here--
--she yanks down the front of her shirt: there's another mark there--
--and here and here and here!
She pulls back her hair: there are two more growing on th her neck.
I don't know how to stop it! I don't know how to kill it! But it's here right now!
Domini's head is in her hands. She's hyperventilating. He her arms around her.
Slow it down, slow it down, whatever it is, we'll figure it out.
That's why she kills children.
I know, I know--
--you don't.
They all look up. Anna's standing in the doorway looking
They put their palms in the blood. And then they press them on your skin.
And Anna walks out of the room.
Domini's lying down, Heather beside her. She's drinking a seems much calmer--though she's got an afghan cinched aro entire body, toes to chin.
You gonna be alright?
Sure. I'm sorry.
No big deal. I'm just trying to understand.
Get some more beer.
(laughs) I think you closed the bar again. I'll have to go out.
Go to the store. When you get back, I'll try to make sense of it for you.
Heather gets up, starts for the door. Stops.
What're you afraid's going to happen?
That they'll start touching us inside our heads.
Heather sticks two six packs inside a car. Double thinks. back and grabs two more.
Heather waits in line. She sees that across the street is Hill Park. Stares aimlessly into the woods, chewing on a nail. She looks seriously worried.
Sweetheart?
Heather shifts her gaze to the Check-Out Clerk--and she s Standing behind the Clerk is
she saw in the loft, with the wound in his head.
Miss?
Heather's eyes dart back to the Clerk.
Are you alright?
Heather's eyes dance around the deli. The Man is gone.
You have a phone?
Just outside--
Heather stands at a payphone by the curb. We hear ringing other end. Finally a pick-up. But an OPERATOR'S VOICE is first:
You have a collect call from Heather. Will you accept the charges?
Long beat on the other end. Finally:
...yes.
The Operator clicks off.
Mom...?
Yes.
I was just calling, I know it's been a long time--
--what do you need this time, Heather?
Nothing. It's nothing like that. I just wanted to know if Dad--
--a sound on the other line of the phone dropping, bangin floor or against a wall--
--Mom...? Mom??
--a Voice comes back on the line. But it's MALE now:
She wants me to talk to you, Heather.
Who is this??
Your mother's pastor.
What happened to my Dad??
There was an accident early this morning. Another car. Your father's injuries were fatal.
Yes.
I'll tell your mother not to expect you at the funeral.
No.
The phone clicks dead on the other end. Heather lets the just drop and begins walking, leaving her two bags of bee sidewalk, in a daze. And then she starts running.
Heather's banging like crazy on the door to the loft. Finally, she hears the sound of Cotter snapping open the He opens the door. The recorded dogs bark. Heather slams behind her.
Where's Domini?
My room, asleep, last I checked.
Heather barges past him and towards Cotter's bedroom.
Heather walks in. The bed's empty. The afghan's lying in the floor-- --along with all of the clothing Domini last had on.
Domini...?
She doesn't bother calling her name again, there's nobody room.
Nick and Cotter look up at Heather, confused.
Well, she's got to be somewhere here.
No one's been in or out since you left. Would've heard the dogs.
Heather dashing up the stairs into the work-loft.
Domini??
Empty.
Cotter poking through the two hallway closets. Nothing.
Nick looking in the closet and under the bed of his and A bedroom. Nobody. Anna sleeps through it all.
Heather really starting to lose it. Rampaging through the room, pushing aside all of Cotter's huge carousel animals behind those things she can't move, dumping things willy- the floor.
Domini!!!!
Cotter helping Heather open one of the windows in the big Looking out on the ledge. Looking down to the sidewalk, f stories below. Nothing.
Fire escape??
Don't have one.
Heather screams out the window:
Dominiiiiiiii!!!
Heather, Anna and Cotter sit at the table nervously. Heat literally shaking.
She would've had to have a key, anyway, to lock the deadbolt behind her.
Well, she got out of here some- how because she's not here!!
Parents. She might've called--
Heather on the phone.
Taos, New Mexico. The Sheriff's Office, please....thank you.
She hangs up. Picks back up. Punches in a number in a blu Someone picks up on the other end:
Good morning, Sheriff's Office.
Yes! I need to speak to Sheriff Von Teer.
He's in a meeting. Could I have him--
--it's urgent!
Could I tell him what it's regarding?
His daughter, for God's sake-- I need to know if he's heard from her this morning.
Beat on the other line.
...the Sheriff is a widower. They never had any children.
Heather is struck dumb.
....Ma'am?
I'm talking to Taos, New Mexico--
--yes--
--the Sheriff's Office--
--yes, Ma'am, can I help you with anything else?--
--his name's Von Teer! His daughter's named Domini!--
--thank you for calling--
The line goes dead. The three of them just stand there, staring at each other petrified. And then Anna walks in the room.
I'm glad she's dead. She brought the thing that killed my child.
Heather sits at the table alone, staring at the 8x10 that made for Domini.
What did you see here that I can't see, damnit!
She runs a finger down the length of the blur in the bran
What is it that scared you so much?
Nick enters, heads for the blotched, '60s vintage Mr. Cof
Finally got her back to sleep.
Nick, what you should do is get her back up and get her to a goddamn doctor.
Jesus, you don't think I know that? You don't think I've tried? She won't fucking go-- she won't leave this place.
She's off her fucking rocker--
--I know!
I'm sorry.
Yeah, I know. It's...alright. We're all a little--
--a lot.
Heather.
Yeah.
Okay. Hypothetically.
Shoot.
You think....there could've been something up in those woods that Anna--

--it's not a could've--there was, Nick. And it fucked up Anna, and did something to Domini, and it caused my father to die, and it's here with us in this place now. And I don't have one single idea in hell what's going to happen next, just that it's going to happen to one of us. And then the other. And then the other. It's going to get into our brains.
And Heather finally loses it and starts weeping--great wr sobs. Nick's a little awkward at first how to comfort her just starts lightly massaging her neck.
There's explanations. Rational explanations for everything that's happened. We'll drive ourselves crazy if we keep obsessing on supernatural what-ifs.
That feels good. Lower--down into my neck.

Nick moves his hands down-- --and somehow the two of them are then guiding his hands her blouse, onto her breasts-- --and she's moaning, and grabbing hard onto his hair-- --and pulling his whole head down to hers. And their lips tongues meet, and they're biting each other like animals- --and his hands are yanking and twisting hard on her brea between her legs-- --and she's literally clawing him with her fingernails, d blood down the length of his chest-- --until she reaches a burgundy-colored mark right at his with tendrils like fingers-- --SNAP!--it's like someone woke them from a dream. They b at each other, baffled--what the hell just happened? But a dream. Nick's chest is streaming blood; there's blood o Heather's lips-- --matching the color of the mark on Nick's waist, and the Heather now sees inside her elbow. They both move away from each other, uncomprehending--and
Nick pacing the floor as Anna lies in bed.

I don't know what it is, but there is something happening here, and it's starting to scare the living shit out me, and look, I'm just not going to argue the point anymore--you want to stay here, stay, but I've got to get the fuck out of here, and I'm begging you to come with me.
I can't.
Then I'm going--
--no, you're not. You love me too much. You don't want to see them kill me.
Cotter's behind the iMac, screening tape millimeter by mi downing one Coke after another. He's so caffed-out, both and his voice is shaking.
This could be something right here, do you think it's some- thing, Heather--?
Heather doesn't even look up. She's just sitting on the b backed couch staring at Domini's 8"x10".
--but that could be just a shadow, I think it's a shadow, it's nothing, Heather, do you think it's nothing--
--and he just keeps prattling on oblivious, eyes fixed on moving at a snail's pace in front of him.
It's about the tree, it's something about the tree.

She puts it down on a cushion and snatches up the dog-ear the "Blair Witch Dossier." Easily flips to the page Domin her: Elly Kedward trussed in the wagon in the woods. Flips backwards in the book, looking for something--
--the goddamn tree, Domini, for chrissake, what?

--and then she stops on the page that shows the anthropol students' sketch of the Parr foundation; the skinny littl in the middle-- --then back to the woodcut of Elly Kedward in the woods-- --then back to Domini's photo of the foundation--the huge
Same trees. They took Elly Kedward out to the same kind of trees.
(still oblivious) --I look and look in the tree, all I ever see, he's always there watching, that stupid owl, over and over--
--Cotter, where can I get on-line?
--anywhere, anywhere, all up and live, all the time--fucking owl--
Heather slips in front of one of Cotter's PC's.
Heather on-line, in the middle of Blair Witch Chat Room, WICCA GIRL: anybody know where tree is they tied Elly Kedward?

Beat. And then a response. COFFIN ROX: Black Hills Heather responds, types: WICCA GIRL: thanx--anybody know where??? in Hills Beat. Response: TREACLE-TREACLE-LITTLE-EILEEN: My two cts? By Rusty Parr' house hadda be that close how else could she whisper into his ear?
Heather stops typing; absorbs this.
Cotter?
Fucking owl!
You think it's possible the tree in the Parr foundation is the same one they tied Elly Kedward to?
No idea--goddamitt!
And then suddenly another response appears in the Chat Ro COFFIN ROX: Check BW Cult book, 1809--they have full account

Heather grunts. Types back: WICCA GIRL: 1 copy in exist. you got it? COFFIN ROX: no just seen it WICCA GIRL: where COFFIN ROX: one of us WICCA GIRL: if you're out there and got it anybody, contact me this mailbx urgent
COFFIN ROX: location described pretty good in section bout first boys disappeared afer Elly dies - James Kurth & another kid
Heather stops typing. To herself:
Boy Kurth.
Heather, does that look like Domini there?
Heather doesn't look up from her screen. Impatient, tryin pieces that don't fit together.
Where?
Down there in the Park.
Heather looks up. Cotter is looking down through the big huge windows; he's waving to someone. Heather gets up. Slowly peers over the loft railing. Squi
A stark-naked Domini is standing in Druid Hill Park. Look them.
Heather and Cotter's pace slows drastically as they try a navigate the overgrown pathways inside the Park. The flor below and above--moonlight barely penetrates where they'r
Domini...?
Cotter puts a finger to her lip. Whispers:
Not the place you want to announce your arrival.
How's she going to know where to--
--things got a way of finding you here.
They walk.
It's freezing.
Next time try putting on shoes--
--the two of them stop dead in their tracks. Through the ahead of them they can see a clearing. Illuminated by the what appears to be an old
with SNOW drifted up nearly to the hubs of its wheels.
are suddenly so cold they can see their breath in the air
What the fuck--??
--I don't know.
He grabs her hand and pulls her through the thicket. They
the snow is now gone. Where the cart was is now just a st rotting cut brush. A clean-up effort someone must have st then abandoned. Heather and Cotter stare at each other, b and not a little afraid.
The moon trying to shoot down through all these trees--can make things funky--
--I saw what I saw.
Yeah. Me too.
The cart they brought Elly Kedward into the woods with--
--into the Black Hills with--200- something miles from here--
--Domini!
They both see it at the same time:
face down at the base of a tree. Heather races over, knee next to it.
Oh, Jesus, what happened, are you--
--and Heather lets out a screech. The face of the body re ELDERLY MALE. Filthy, tongue lolling black out of its mou been dead for some time.
Be it still alive, James?
What--
Heather turns--
wild-eyed and wielding sticks, RUSH AT HEATHER--
--then finish the job, lads!
--Heather screeches again, throws up her arms to protect
Jesus!
Heather looks up: Cotter's lying on the ground, holding h bleeding forehead.
What the fuck you do that for??
Heather looks at her hand. She's clenching a sharp stick The Little Boys are gone. The body of the Dead Man is not
I didn't.
She grabs his hand, pulls him up. They start running.
Heather and Cotter at the table, still out of breath and as they tell Nick what happened.
--and one of the little boys, his name was James. As in the boy James Kurth--the first child to disappear from the town of Blair after they banished Elly Kedward.
A look of alarm comes to Nick's face. But he says nothing
What?
I dunno it's anything. It's a name Anna's mentioned--from her dreams.
I can't handle this anymore.
He produces a large, thick spliff and torches it up. Big passes it to Heather, who takes an even bigger one.
How much of that stuff you guys been smoking?
Enough to keep sane.
Enough to make shapes and shadows in the dark into something else.
Spare me.
Hey, chemicals, fear, sleep- deprivation--and a round-the-clock obsession with the occult--hell've a recipe for a mind-fuck.
Except we seem about 18 times more together than you.
Heather spit-takes a lung-full of smoke.
I'd strongly advise you to join us--
--before you lose your emotional lunch.
(shrugging) Yeah, what the hell.
He takes the joint, sucks in mightily--
Atta boy--

--and then the whole kitchen seems to explode-- --GLASS and MULLIONS from the big window in the room come in shards at them-- --and then when the noise finally stops, and the flying d all hit the floor, they all look down and see:
broken and bleeding from its header through the window. S and then dying. Eyes wide, staring up at them. No one says a word. They just look at it.
A lot of chairs, but nobody's sitting down. Cotter, Heath Nick all look like their nerves are fraying down to bare
We are being fucked with here, someone or something.
Domini.
Why in the world would she--
--why in the world would she just fly the coop in the first place?
Chrissake: why any of this?
I think it's time to get out of here.
Nobody's going anywhere--
--hell, I don't think I'm ever leaving this place again--

--one of us, all of us--I have no idea--brought whatever this thing is back here. We're not going to go out there and spread it around like Typhoid Mary. We're gonna figure it out, we're gonna bring a goddamn end to it.
Domini's the only logical explanation.
We're not dealing with fucking logic here!

It's Domini, it's not Domini, I don't care--all I know is I'm not dealing with something--anything-- snuffing me in my sleep. I want to do what we did in the woods-- surveillance of this whole place 24/7, with somebody monitoring those cameras every second. There's something, somebody here, I want to see 'em coming.
I thought all your equipment got stolen.
All the shit that was worth anything, yes. You'd be amazed, though, what you can get free on the 'net.
He opens a desk drawer--there must be a dozen little palm corders in there.
What Cotter lacks in other equipment, he makes up for wit huge SPOOLS of it--and he's running it from the various t cams to a motley bank of monitors he's set up on the kitc
duct-tapes one of the little units on the top of a closet frame in the hallway.
sees he has an excellent angle on the front door/elevator
watches half asleep and befuddled in their bedroom as Nic camera on a jerry-rigged broom-handle tripod.
connects the cables in the kitchen--sees Anna and a clear the bedroom door.
collaborate on installing a camera from Cotter's work-lof provides a view of the dark area under the work-loft. Nic the camera on a rope, while Heather guides and supports t attached.
watches the camera descend on one of the monitors. Satisf view it's giving him, he yells:
That's good! Tie it off!

Nick does so. Ties the rope securely around the loft rail a slip knot in the loose end and lassoes it over one of t beams above to keep it from being a hazard. He has to jum the rope as it comes down again from the beam-- --stumbles backwards slightly as he catches it-- --hitting the spindly loft railing-- --which suddenly SNAPS! And Nick goes tumbling out into mid-air, the slip-knot in in his hand the only thing keeping him from plummeting 20 the floor below--
--Jee-zus!!!--
sees it happen on the monitor.
--Christ!!
He dashes out of the kitchen.
Heather is trying to lift Nick back up by the rope by she physical strength she doesn't have--
I can't do it!
Don't! You're making me lose my grip.
I'm coming! I'm coming!
And Cotter comes dashing in with a tall metal step ladder
Just hold on!
I can't!
Cotter splays the ladder open, starts clambering up it.
Just let it go, I've got you!
What're you nuts--
--it's less than four feet, just--
--shit!!!
Nick loses his grip--starts falling-- --Cotter snatches hold of him as he falls, pinning Nick b ladder and his torso. The ladder wobbles precariously--
--don't move, don't even breathe--
--and then the ladder finally comes to a stable rest. Nick is savagely shaken as he slowly climbs down.
Jesusjesusjesus....
Ditto Cotter:
Yeah--please don't do that again.
A giggle is heard from the doorway to the big room. They
is standing there, laughing with her hand against her mou little child. She sing-songs:
I could see up your dress.

Cotter, Heather and Nick watch the monitors on the table silence. Drinking coffee. They all look majorly exhausted of them look in any immediate danger of falling asleep. T dart from monitor to monitor, relievedly seeing nothing-- Anna tossing restlessly in bed. Heather sees that Nick is massaging something on his fore making him wince. Without a word, she rolls his sleeve up A wine-colored mark that looks vaguely like a jagged J.
Gothic rune--the letter "S."
Or a blood blister--or a bruise.
Must be that blue collar life we all lead.
Cotter pulls up his pant leg: two blurry burgundy marks-- shapes overlapping each other.
That's a "j."
For "James?"
Goes right along with these two.
She pulls back her hair--where jaw meets neck: two smudge that together look like badly-drawn lowercase "n"s.
Put 'em together that's a "k." James Kurth--
--or Lyme Disease or poison sumac, or God knows what-else we could have picked up in the woods.
You know what we picked up in the woods--

--and then there's a sharp knock at the door. All three sets of eyes zoom towards the sound, but no one The knocking grows louder, more insistent. Still, they re frozen. Frightened. They look at the monitor giving an angle of the door/elev Nothing can be seen--just a dark blur in the door's peeph indicating someone's standing in the elevator.
Who?
No one ever comes here.
Have to open the door to find out.
The knocking increases, along with muffled shouts of:
Cotter...? Cotter...?
Cotter gets up and slowly walks to the door. The rapping shouting increasing in volume with each step. Finally, a deep breath. And then Cotter looks through the hole. He sees:
his Techie friend from the Film Lab glowering back at him
I know you're in there, you piece of shit!
(quietly) You have to go.
Not until I get that Beta Cam back! We're both in a world of shit here!!
(quietly) I can't.
It's my fucking job, man!!
I can't let you in.
Sid starts knocking again. Cotter walks back to the kitchen. Sits down in front of t monitors. Watches as the knocking continues. Finally stop expression on Cotter's face never changes.
So quiet, so tense, they can hear the clocks ticking all loft: 4:10a.m.
I should check on Anna.
Check the monitor, she's fine.
She's far from "fine."
You're needed here--keep watching--
--f'chrissake, Heather, it's not like the two of us are gonna doze off he leaves for two seconds--
--I don't trust anybody, not even me, anymore--
--shhhh! #5, there's something up there!
Their eyes all go to the Monitor with the view of Cotter' loft. Beat. They freeze. A slight WHIRRING--then slow WHOOSHING heard. Movement se darkness.
What?
One of the printers.
Cotter gets up.
No. We all go.
Anna--
--fuck Anna!
No, you--
Cotter handing a sheaf of print-outs to Heather.
--it's for you. Came through email. How it started printing without a command, though--
Heather looks up at them in astonishment; dithered:
--it's the "Blair Witch Cult"--a copy-- some pages from--one of them on the site must've gotten my message--
--who?
Doesn't say--it's just these pages.
She tries to make out the ancient, smeared scrawls of thi 200 year old book.
(reading) "taken by the witch as they were marked by her--first Jamie Kurth when the stain appeared on his brow that next summer--
--the next page is illegible, Heather flips forward:

"for t'was said he and Jon Edmunds and other boys who found Elly Kedward still on her tree in the snow. Poking her with sticks finding her still living. Taking her bonds and noosing them to her neck, hanging her from her tree until she perished."
Heather looks up at the others in wide-eyed.
That's the little boys. Elly Kedward didn't die from "exposure" out there: she was executed. (resumes reading) "Killing Elly Kedward, but not the witch herself, who floated from the mortal husk--"
Heather looks up; she echoes Domini's words:
"It's why the witch kills children."
I thought all witches were benign and good.
Not this one.
Heather tries to rouse Anna in bed.
I need you to talk to me, talk to me about the dreams--about James, the other boys.
I don't...I don't understand them myself.
Try, please, Anna--
--bad boys, mean boys, cowardly boys--just like Domini.
What do you mean?
A coward too. That's why she had to go.
What happened to her, where did she go?
Don't know--just that she was afraid--
--Anna--
Anna winces.
What, are you alright?
My eye, is there something in my eye?
Heather looks.
Not that I can see.
Closer. Lift the lid and look-- it hurts.
Heather lifts Anna's eyelid, gets close to her face and l
No.
Closer.

And Anna gently guides Heather's face down. Begins stroki the next thing Heather knows, her body is gravitating tow Anna's. She's kissing her, stroking and fondling her as A her fingers. Pulling down the covers, guiding Heather dow length of her body to-- --a spot on the mattress between Anna's legs that's soake with fresh, gleaming blood. Heather yanks herself away, now seeing that the entire ma blood-covered. Runs from the room.
Heather stares at her face in the mirrored surface of a t Blood blots on her cheek--vaguely in the shape of little prints. She's hyperventilating as she tells Cotter.
Remember....what Mary Brown said-- she could see the witch's hands on my face, her mouth sucking on mine.
Anna's the witch.
Nick enters.
What the fuck's going on here?
Does she have marks, Nick--like the ones we have, that Domini had?
Why?
Does she, goddamnit??
Not that I've seen--but that has no meaning--that means nothing.
Why was she exempted, Nick?
Maybe whatever they are, they just haven't appeared yet on her?
You really believe that?
Beat.
It's possible for chrissake--
--the marks appear, then you disappear. Like the little Kurth boy, like Domini, as soon as they come to full bloom--and mine are!
She pulls down her blouse--the marks on her neck have gro are the size of--and very clear image of--the palm-prints child, ringing around Heather's neck as if strangling her
Mine, too. And so are yours, pal.
He points to Nick's exposed midriff--the stains have spre his waist into his abdomen--
Like a blueprint for disembowelment.
There are other explanations! She is not the goddamn witch, that's insane!
Then just give me one of your explanations that all three of us'll buy.
I don't....
--and then Nick hears giggling. His eyes and everyone's e one of the video monitors:

of the loft. Where they see Anna twirling round and round tip-toes, laughing, as though she were simultaneously bei and looking up the dress and giggling at the person being Now even Nick looks petrified.
The Big Room. Nick enters on the run.
I want to see something!
Whatever you want.
The clothes--take 'em off-- I want to see every square inch--
--no, what's wrong with you?
Watch on the monitor: Nick showing the huge mark on his t
Are you marked like this??
Why?
I see for proof positive you're the goddamn witch--
Anna dashes from the room.
Heather grabs her, as Anna's trying to open the door to e recorded dogs start barking madly.
You killed Domini, didn't you, witch??
I'm not a witch, you're all crazy!
Anna runs panicked into the kitchen--and right into Cotte grabs her by the arms.
Just say you are--we won't hurt you--
--Heather runs in behind her--
--we'll just make you go away, so you can't hurt anyone else--
--Nick enters the kitchen--
--like you hurt the baby--
--what're you saying?? I didn't have anything to do with--
--the witch kills children--
I haven't killed any--
--Jamie Kurth, Jonathan Edmunds--
(in terror) --my God, Nick???
Just say the words, Anna.
She tries to dodge Nick and get back to the elevator, he off. Ditto, the other direction and Heather-- --Anna sprints up the stairs--
--and finds she's got nowhere to go but down--20 feet wor down. And Nick, Heather and Cotter are closing in on her stairs.
Please! Please...? I haven't done anything.
Bullshit! Talk!
Nick!!
Out of my hands.
Cotter barges past them all, grabs the tope that Nick dan the loft space with--
What're you doing??
--Cotter throws the slip-knot loop around her neck.
Hang you like the witch you are, unless--
--Nick!!
Confess!
Cotter tightens the rope.
Alright! Fuck you, fuck all of you! I'm her.
Heather grabs the vid-cam from the railing and starts rec her:
Oh, Jesus, no--
--fuck your bullshit pieties! You were the next to die, asshole!

head_text.subj: PAGE 102 IS MISSING FROM THE HARD COPY OF THIS SCRIPT

text: A dizzying montage of video "real" footage much like the the film. TV Reporters telling us that "once again, like Columbine "Basketball Diaries," life has imitated violent art. In t the Blair Witch Project," where, yesterday obsessed fans film performed ritualistic murder--" Nick, Heather and Cotter seen: in cuffs, being led into t Baltimore Police Station. Seen: grainy static-cam of them being interrogated. Seen: news-film of the inside of the Loft--where Anna was "murdered." And then a closet where an unidentified nude found similarly "executed." The News camera zooms in on t body of Domini crumpled in that closet, visible rope burn neck. Seen: Nick's confession. That Anna admitted to being The Seen: the footage Heather shot of Anna "confessing." But all the police and we see is Anna with a rope around pleading to Nick, Heather and Cotter not to kill her: "I done anything!!! Why are you doing this??? Please, God--"
